content.questionText: What is the type of computer memory that retains its data when it's turned off?
What is the type of computer memory that requires power to store data?
In the context of storage devices, what does the acronym "HDD" stand for?
If the memory in an HDD remains stored after it's disconnected from a power source, what type of computer memory does an HDD use?
A typical desktop hard drive would operate at how many revolutions per second?
What is the storage device that consists of a sealed case containing spinning magnetic disks where the data is stored on?
What is the component of an HDD that reads and writes data to the magnetic disks?
What is the name of the standard computer bus interface that modern-day HDDs use?
What is the name of the computer bus interface that the SATA interface superceeded?
What is the name of the type of data transmission referring to the sending of data one bit at a time?
What is the name of the type of data transmission referring to the sending of data as multiple bits simultaneously?
What is the __average__ transfer speed of a SATA cable in gigabits per second?
What is the terminology used to refer to the ability to insert or remove a storage device from a computer system without stopping or shutting down the system?
In the context of storage devices, what does the acronym "SSD" stand for?
What is the storage device that has no moving parts, uses flash memory chips to store data, and has very fast data transfer?

What is the storage device that combines the low cost and large capacity of magnetic disks and the speed of an SSD?
What is the storage device that combines the low cost and large capacity of magnetic disks and the speed of an SSD?
What is the storage device that employs magnetic disks for memory storage but uses flash memory for caching of data?
What is the terminology used to refer to storage devices that are attached to a computer from the outside, in contrast to those internal to the computer?
What is the name of the storage device that provides an inexpensive way to back up data from a hard drive sequentially to a tape?
What is the name of the storage device that, because the data from a hard drive was backed up to it sequentially, restores data in the same order as it was backed up?

https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/3/39/Dds_tape_drive_01.jpg 
What is the name of storage device in the picture?
In the context of storage devices, what does the acronym "CD" stand for?
Please provide the correct acronym for the storage device known as "compact disk read only memory".
What is the terminology used to refer to data that can only be read but not changed or written to?
What is the name of the storage device that reads data from a CD-ROM disk?
In the context of storage devices, what does the acronym "CD-R" stand for?
In the context of storage devices, what does the acronym "CD-RW" stand for?
What is the name of the storage device that can read or write data to a CD using a moving laser assembly?
How many times can a CD-RW drive write data to a CD-R disk?
What is the name of the CD that allows for a CD-RW drive to write data to it multiple times?
What is the name of the CD that allows for a CD-RW drive to write data to it only once?
How many megabytes of data can a standard CD hold?
content.extraInfo: Standard CDs have a diameter of 120 millimetres (4.7 in) and are designed to hold up to 74 minutes of uncompressed stereo digital audio or about 650 MB of data. Capacity is routinely extended to 80 minutes and 700 MB by arranging more data closely on the same sized disc.

content.questionText: What is the name of the device that largely replaced the ordinary CD-ROM drive because of the larger capacity of DVD disks?
Approximately how many gigabytes can a single-sided, single-layer DVD hold?
What is the name of the device that reads DVD disks?
What is the name of the device that can change or write data to DVD disks?
In the context of storage devices, what does the acronym "DVD" stand for?
What does the "DL" stand for in the acronym "DVD+R DL"?
Approximately how many gigabytes of data are available on a DVD+R DL disk?
What does the "SS" stand for in the acronym "DVD SS SL"?
What does the "SL" stand for in the acronym "DVD SS SL"?
What does the "SL" stand for in the acronym "DVD SS SL"?
Approximately how many gigbytes of data are available in a "DVD SS SL"?
Approximately how many gigbytes of data are available in a "DVD SS DL"?
What is the name of the storage device that reads Blu-Ray disks?
What was the year that the Blu-Ray optical drive was released officially?
content.extraInfo: Afterwards, it continued to be developed until its official worldwide release on June 20, 2006, beginning the high-definition optical disc format war, where Blu-ray Disc competed with the HD DVD format.

content.questionText: Approximately how many gigabytes of storage does a Blu-Ray disk offer?
What is the name of the storage device that allows you to burn data to a Blu-Ray disk one time?
What is the name of the storage device that allows you erase and overwrite data on a Blu-Ray disk?
Approximately how many gigabytes of data would a BD-R DL disk hold?
examples: "BD-R" stands for Blu-Ray Disk-Readable, and "DL" stands for dual-layer. Since a single-layer Blu-Ray disk holds 25GB of data, a dual-layer Blu-Ray disk holds approximately 50GB of data.

content.questionText: What is the name of the miniature storage device with a USB interface that stores data on memory chips?
